p: Contrary to our expectations of latitudinal and/or altitudinal range shifts our results show dramatic reductions in the overall bioclimatic suitability of P. parlatorei across its entire range ( figure 1; electronic supplementary material, figure S1). These reductions in suitability were more moderate for RCP2.6. Under this scenario, the central and northern populations retained a certain amount of suitability in 2050 and through 2070 ( figure 1; electronic supplementary material, figure S1); however, the southern range of the species (population 21–24) becomes virtually unsuitable even by 2050. The scenario RCP8.5 shows a much stronger effect with overall strong reductions of suitability ( p < 0.4) by 2070 throughout the entire species’ range ( figure 1).
